definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The zoo has monkey ugly, people see people to vomit.
sentences.chinese: 动物园有只猴子奇丑无比，人见人吐。

sentences.english: Vicky Zhao portrayed a very ugly person in the film Shaolin Football.
sentences.chinese: 赵薇在电影《少林足球》中扮演一个奇丑无比的人。

sentences.english: This blackened the nose of the golden Buddha, making it especially ugly.
sentences.chinese: 结果，金佛的鼻子给熏黑了，奇丑无比。

sentences.english: "Its face was hideous, and was ruddy reddish brown in colour."The
sentences.chinese: 它长着一张奇丑无比的脸，是红彤彤的棕色。

sentences.english: Some people came closer only extremely ugly dog, then sideways away.
sentences.chinese: 有人走近一看是只奇丑无比的小狗，便侧身走开了。

sentences.english: It was as ugly as medusa though she was a belle when she was alive.
sentences.chinese: 本来是个美女，死的时候奇丑无比。

sentences.english: I can draw the simple villain only, and it moreover the wonderful clown is incomparable.
sentences.chinese: 我就只会画简单的小人，而且奇丑无比。
